intro: Sarcostemma bilobum, commonly known as the two-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Sarcostemma bilobum is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
